Description.div:
Unique identifier of a coupon.
CouponID is not passed.

Indicates the status of the coupon validation. Following table lists the possible coupon status codes:
CouponStatusMsgCode Description Coupon Status Attributes returned
YPM_RULE_VALID The coupon is valid. None
YPM_RULE_INVALID The coupon does not exist. None
YPM_RULE_PARTIAL The coupon is partially valid. None
YPM_RULE_NOT_ACTIVE The coupon is not active.
PricingStatus of the coupon
YPM_RULE_NOT_YET_EFFECTIVE The coupon is not yet active.
StartDateActive of the coupon
YPM_RULE_EXPIRED The coupon is expired.
EndDateActive of the coupon
YPM_RULE_BAD_CUSTOMER The coupon is not assigned to the CustomerID
CustomerID passed in the input. A blank CustomerID indicates that the coupon has no assignments with void CustomerID for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_BAD_CUSTOMER_CONTACT The coupon is not assigned to the CustomerContactID
CustomerContactID passed in the input. A blank CustomerContactID indicates that the coupon has no assignments with void CustomerContactID for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_BAD_REGION The coupon is not assigned to the passed RegionKey or PersonInfo
RegionKey passed or derived based on PersonInfo from the input. A blank RegionKey indicates that the coupon has no assignments with void RegionKey for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_BAD_ATTRIBUTE The coupon is not assigned to the passed customer attribute Any one of the input CustomerType, RelationshipType, Vertical or any extended attribute of the YPM_PRICING_RULE_ASSIGNMENT that didn't match the coupon assignments. A blank attribute value indicates that the coupon is assigned to all seller organization.
YPM_RULE_NOT_ASSIGNED_TO_SELLER The coupon is not created by or assigned to the passed seller organization
SellerOrganizationCode passed in the input. A blank SellerOrganizationCode indicates that the coupon has assignments with void SellerOrganizationCode.
YPM_RULE_TARGET_SKU_MISSING The item on which this coupon applies adjustments does not exist in this order
TargetItemID and TargetUnitOfMeasure of the coupon.
YPM_RULE_CONDITION_NOT_SATISFIED The coupon condition is not satisfied. Hence the rule is not fired. None.
YPM_RULE_NOT_APPLICABLE The coupon is not applicable. For example a coupon is passed and it is not applicable when RunCatalogOnlyRules is set to Y . None.
YPM_RULE_BAD_PAYMENT_METHOD The coupon is not applicable to the passed PaymentTypein PaymentTypeList from the input.
PaymentType passed in PaymentTypeList from the input.
Note: The above codes are returned by the default coupon validation logic. The user exit implementation of the coupon validation can return any code including the ones in the above table.

Indicates whether the coupon is valid or not. This does not indicate whether the coupon is applicable or not. Refer to CouponStatusMsgCode to determine whether the coupon is applicable or not. Refer to the validateCoupon API for details on how a coupon is determined to be valid. If ValidateReferences was 'Y' the value for this attribute can be Y|N|P. The value 'P' means that the references for coupon are partially valid. Some of the references are valid and some of them are not.
Order to be priced.

If ApplyOnlyItemLevelPricingRules is passed as Y then rules that are applicable at the item level will be run.
Pricing rules with IsItemRule value as 'Y' are executed.
Passed coupons with IsItemRule value as 'Y' are executed.
Order total pricing rules are suppressed.
Shipping charge calculation, shipping rules execution and shipping coupon execution are suppressed.
Default value is N .
An identifier of the customer. This is a pass through field available to user exits.

Currency used for pricing data selection.
Currency is not passed.
Currency is not valid.
An identifier of the customer. This is a pass through field available to user exits.

The identifier for the customer.
If not void then CustomerID must be of one of the valid customer.
Document type for order. For use ONLY with the manager overrides framework in the context of an order.

Indicates whether manager overrides should be considered. If enabled, DocumentType must be passed, and preexisting transaction violations may be passed. If disabled, neither document type nor transaction violations will be considered. This functionality is intended for order context only.
The EnterpriseCode on which behalf pricing inquiry is being made. If not passed OrganizationCode primary enterprise will be used.
The OrderReference is the Order Header Key.

Pricing data is read on behalf of the organization specified by OrganizationCode.
OrganizationCode is not passed.
OrganizationCode is not valid.

Date on which the pricing is requested. If void it is defaulted to current date and time. If SellerOrganizationCode is found and enterprise level rule "ENABLE_SELLER_TIMEZONE_FOR_PRICE_CALCULATION" is set then PricingDate passed in the input will be converted in to time zone of the Seller organization and pricing happens based on this converted date.
If RepriceAllLines is passed as Y then unit price for all the lines except priceLocked will be recalculated by the pricing engine. Default value is N .

If RunCatalogOnlyRules is passed as Y then rules that are applicable in item listing, i.e.
pricing rules with RuleType as ITEM_QUANTITY are executed.
manual rules with RuleType as ITEM_QUANTITY are executed for suggestion.
passed coupons with RuleCategory as PRICING are executed.
combination and order total pricing rules are suppressed.
shipping charge calculation, shipping rules execution and shipping coupon execution are suppressed.
Default value is N .

Pricing data is either maintained or assigned to the organization specified by SellerOrganizationCode.
SellerOrganizationCode is not passed.

If SuggestManualRuleAdjustments is passed as Y then any manual adjustment rules applicablable are returned in the output XML under ApplicableManualRules and ApplicableManualRuleSummary elements. Default value is N .
If SuppressAutomaticRuleExecution is passed as Y then pricing rules and shipping rules are not applied unless they are manual rules or coupon rules. Default value is N .
If SuppressRuleExecution is passed as Y then pricing rules, manual rules, shipping rules and coupons are not applied. Default value is N .
If SuppressShipping is passed as Y then none of the shipping calculation is executed. This includes, shipping charge calculation and shipping rules execution. Default value is N .

Attributes of customer used for selecting the pricing entities. If this element is not passed and CustomerID is passed then the attributes of the customer are defaulted from the customer's profile. Defaulting of PersonInfo from the customer's profile for different customer type is as below:
Type of Customer Default for PersonInfo
Business Default sold to address, if void then default bill to address.
Consumer Default bill to address.
Anonymous No defaults.
The level of a customer with the enterprise.

Type of customer. If neither CustomerID nor CustomerType are passed then CustomerType is defaulted to 03 .
If not void then CustomerType must be one of the allowed values.

The region of the customer. If RegionKey is void then PersonInfo element is used to determine region of the customer. If both RegionKey and PersonInfo are not void then RegionKey takes precedence over PersonInfo to determine region of the customer.
If not void then RegionKey should be a valid region within the region schema that is configured for purpose SELLING .
The type of the relationship that exists between an organization and an enterprise.
Vertical of the customer.
Address of the customer.

Contains tax related information for various entities in the system. If ChargeCategory and ChargeName are not provided, tax will be considered as a billable and positive charge. If not implementing YFSRecalculateLineTaxUE , ChargeCategory , Tax , and TaxPercentage are required for the default repricing logic.

The tax amount. Tax cannot be less than zero. During the default repricing logic, this is recalculated using the TaxPercentage and the price of the related ChargeCategory . This can be overridden with the YFSRecalulateHeaderTaxUE.

Attribute.Name: InvoicedTax
Attribute.Description: The amount of this tax which had been invoiced.

Attribute.Name: OverallTax
Attribute.Description: The total amount of this tax.

Attribute.Name: RemainingTax
Attribute.Description: The amount of this tax that has not been invoiced.

Description.div:
Manual rule adjustment that needs to be applied on the entire order. Both order level as well as item level manual rules can be passed here. If an item level rule is passed, the adjustment is applied only to the applicable order lines. If a rule adjustment is passed multilple times, then only the last one is considered.
If both PricingRuleName and PricingRuleKey is void.

Adjustment to apply as part of this manual rule. The adjustment passed is evaluated agains the manual rule action that is applicable on this order. If the passed adjustment is void and there is an Adjustment specified on the manual rules' action, then the manual rule action's Adjustment is used.
Primary key of the manual rule.
Name of the manual rule.
Adjustment to be applied on the order.
Adjustment identifier for the manual adjustment.
The charge category. For example, Labeling or Handling.
The name of the charge. For example, Price Ticket.
Reference information about charge.

Attribute.Name: Carrier
Attribute.Description: The carrier assigned to the order. This is a pass through field available to user exits..

Description.div: Shipping charge for the order.
Coupon identifier.

Element.Description: Order line associated with the order.

Description.div:
The delivery method for the order line.
Valid Values:
SHP - Order line is being shipped.
DEL - Order line is being delivered.
PICK - Order line is picked.
Default value is SHP .

Indicates that the order line is eligible for shipping charge discounts. Default value is Y . If the flag is set then this order line is applicable for adjustments generated by pricing rule or coupon having DistributeAdjustment as Y , RuleType as ORDER_TOTAL and RuleCategory as SHIPPING .

Attribute.Name: IsLinePriceForInformationOnly
Attribute.Description:
Indicates that the price for the order line is for information purposes only. These order lines do not participate in any of the rules and coupons. Default value is N
.

Description.div: Indicates that the UnitPrice for the order line is locked and is specified in the input. Default value is N .

Item identifier.
ItemID should not be void.
LineID is used to identify a line. It is passed by the caller of pricing query.
List price of an order line. If IsPriceLocked is set to Y then ListPrice will be used as a passthrough value.

The quantity of item which needs to be priced.
Quantity is void.

Indicates that the UnitPrice for the order line is specified in the input or pricingEngine needs to get the price. Default value is Y .
Note that if multiple order lines exist with the same ItemID and UOM values, and at least one order line contains RepriceLine=Y, then all order lines are set as RepriceLine=Y.
The unit of measure of the item.

Unit price for an item of the order line.
If IsPriceLocked is set to Y and UnitPrice is void.

Contains tax related information for various entities in the system. If ChargeCategory and ChargeName are not provided, tax will be considered as a billable and positive charge. If not implementing YFSRecalculateLineTaxUE , ChargeCategory , Tax , and TaxPercentage are required for the default repricing logic.

Attribute.Name: ChargeCategory
Attribute.Description:
The charge category for which tax is being charged. For example, Labeling or Handling. To specify the tax for the line price, use the charge category
Price
.

Description.div: The tax amount. Tax cannot be less than zero. During the default repricing logic, this is recalculated using the TaxPercentage and the price of the related ChargeCategory . This can be overridden with the YFSRecalulateLineTaxUE.

Attribute.Name: InvoicedTax
Attribute.Description: The amount of this tax which had been invoiced.

Attribute.Name: OverallTax
Attribute.Description: The total amount of this tax.

Attribute.Name: RemainingTax
Attribute.Description: The amount of this tax that has not been invoiced.

Description.div:
Manual rule adjustment that needs to be applied on this order line. Only item level manual rules can be passed here. If the same item level manual rule is passed at order as well as at order line, then the one passed at the order line wins only if the manual rule adjustment at order line is valid else the order level adjustment is considered. If a rule adjustment is passed multilple times, then only the last one is considered.
If both PricingRuleName and PricingRuleKey is void.

Adjustment to apply as part of this manual rule. The adjustment passed is evaluated agains the manual rule action that is applicable on this order. If the passed adjustment is void and there is an Adjustment specified on the manual rules' action, then the manual rule action's Adjustment is used.
Primary key of the manual rule.
Name of the manual rule.
Adjustment identifier for the manaul adjustment.
Adjustment to apply on the entire order line.
Adjustment for every unit of the order line item.
The charge category. For example, Labeling or Handling.
The name of the charge. For example, Price Ticket.
Reference information about charge.
Coupon identifier.
Provided as input so the overrideGetOrderPriceUE can utilize this information for external calculations.
Pass through attribute that can indicate if the modification type provided may impact pricing.
Pass through attribute that indicates the level in which the modification type is applicable.
Pass through attribute that indicates the type of Modification that is applicable to the order line.

Attribute.Name: Carrier
Attribute.Description: The carrier assigned to the line. This is a pass through field available to user exits. .

Description.div: Shipping charge for the line.
The LinePriceId is the AdditionalLinePriceKey of the existing additional line price record.

Manual rule adjustment that needs to be applied on this Additional Line Price. Only item level manual rules can be passed here. If the same item level manual rule is passed at order or order line as well as additional line price, then the one passed at the additional lnie price wins only if the manual rule adjustment at additional line price is valid else the order level or order line level adjustment is considered. If a rule adjustment is passed multilple times, then only the last one is considered.
If both PricingRuleName and PricingRuleKey is void.

Adjustment to apply as part of this manual rule. The adjustment passed is evaluated agains the manual rule action that is applicable on this order. If the passed adjustment is void and there is an Adjustment specified on the manual rules' action, then the manual rule action's Adjustment is used.
Primary key of the manual rule.
Name of the manual rule.
Adjustment identifier for the manual adjustment.
Adjustment to apply on the entire additional line price.
Adjustment for every unit of the order line item.
The charge category. For example, Labeling or Handling.
The name of the charge. For example, Price Ticket.
Reference information about charge.
Coupon identifier.
Overrides the entire adjustment for the rule. If supplied the value of this attribute will be the adjustment applied.
Value of this attribute will override maximum adjustment limit defined for Coupon.
If 'Y' the references will be validated. When value is 'Y' CouponID is optional. Default value is 'N'.
Provided as input so the overrideGetOrderPriceUE can utilize this information for external calculations.
Pass through attribute that can indicate if the modification type provided may impact pricing.
Pass through attribute that indicates the level in which the modification type is applicable.
Pass through attribute that indicates the type of Modification that is applicable to the order.
Pricing Rule with this Payment type will be considered.
Payment type of Pricing Rule.
Represents preexisting violations against this transaction. For use with the manager overrides framework in the context of an order.
Represents new violations against this transaction. For use with the manager overrides framework in the context of an order.
The total number of Approval Status records returned.
The total number of Transaction Violation Reference records returned.

Action to take.
Valid Values:
Create - Creates new record. If the record already exists, it is neither created nor modified.
Delete - Deletes existing record.
The default behavior is Create.
Name of the attribute on the coupon or in the input due to which the coupon is not applicable.
Value of the attribute.
Pricing Rule associated with the Coupon.
Description of the Pricing Rule associated with the Coupon.
Primary Key of Pricing Rule associated with the Coupon.

Indicates the status of the reference validation. Following table lists the possible reference status codes:
CouponStatusMsgCode Description Coupon Status Attributes returned
YPM_CODE_VALID The reference is valid. None
YPM_CODE_INVALID The reference does not exist. None
YPM_RULE_BAD_CUSTOMER The reference is not assigned to the CustomerID
None
YPM_RULE_BAD_CUSTOMER_CONTACT The reference is not assigned to the CustomerContactID
None
Indicates whether the reference is valid or not. Valid values are Y|N
Name of the attribute on the coupon or in the input due to which the coupon is not applicable.
Value of the attribute.
